title: Not the First Doctor to Underestimate Pharmacists
sub_head: Their knowledge of drug interactions is often greater than that of other health professionals.
body:
Henry Miller’s op-ed doubting pharmacists’ ability to recognize drug interactions involving ritonavir (“Biden’s Half-Baked Covid Treatment Plan,” March 4) betrays a view of pharmacists that is decades out of date.
Pharmacy curricula long ago transited from educating chemists to educating practitioners who collaborate with physicians and make or recommend clinical decisions. Drug interactions are a major focus, and pharmacists’ knowledge here is often greater than that of other health professionals.
